content:
TITLE: Running the App Locally - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to run the Next.js application locally using `pnpm`. This will start the development server, typically on localhost:3000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nickscamara/open-deep-research/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Database Migrations - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to run database migrations using `pnpm`. This is required to set up the database schema.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nickscamara/open-deep-research/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm db:migrate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Max Function Duration - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the maximum duration for a Vercel function by modifying the `MAX_DURATION` environment variable in the `.env` file. This is important because the default timeout might exceed the limits of certain Vercel tiers, like the Hobby tier.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nickscamara/open-deep-research/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
MAX_DURATION=60
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Reasoning Model Configuration - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure the reasoning model by setting the `REASONING_MODEL` and `BYPASS_JSON_VALIDATION` environment variables in the `.env` file.  `REASONING_MODEL` specifies the model to use for reasoning tasks, and `BYPASS_JSON_VALIDATION` is used when the model doesn't natively support JSON.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nickscamara/open-deep-research/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Choose one of: deepseek-reasoner, deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-R1
REASONING_MODEL=deepseek-ai/DeepSeek-R1

# Required when using models that don't support JSON schema (like deepseek-reasoner)
BYPASS_JSON_VALIDATION=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install the project's dependencies using `pnpm`.  `pnpm` is used as the package manager for this project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nickscamara/open-deep-research/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding TogetherAI Dependency - Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to add the `@ai-sdk/togetherai` dependency using `pnpm`. This is needed if you want to use TogetherAI's models.
SOURCE: https://github.com/nickscamara/open-deep-research/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm add @ai-sdk/togetherai
```
